title: Exploring the Effectiveness of Deep Features from Domain-Specific Foundation Models in Retinal Image Synthesis
summary:
The adoption of neural network models in medical imaging has been constrained
by strict privacy regulations, limited data availability, high acquisition
costs, and demographic biases. Deep generative models offer a promising
solution by generating synthetic data that bypasses privacy concerns and
addresses fairness by producing samples for under-represented groups. However,
unlike natural images, medical imaging requires validation not only for
fidelity (e.g., Fr\'echet Inception Score) but also for morphological and
clinical accuracy. This is particularly true for colour fundus retinal imaging,
which requires precise replication of the retinal vascular network, including
vessel topology, continuity, and thickness. In this study, we in-vestigated
whether a distance-based loss function based on deep activation layers of a
large foundational model trained on large corpus of domain data, colour fundus
imaging, offers advantages over a perceptual loss and edge-detection based loss
functions. Our extensive validation pipeline, based on both domain-free and
domain specific tasks, suggests that domain-specific deep features do not
improve autoen-coder image generation. Conversely, our findings highlight the
effectiveness of con-ventional edge detection filters in improving the
sharpness of vascular structures in synthetic samples.
title_zh: 探索領域特定基礎模型中的深度特徵在視網膜影像合成中的有效性
summary_zh: 本研究探討利用深度生成模型合成視網膜影像，以解決醫療影像中隱私、數據稀缺和偏差問題。我們比較了基於領域特定大型基礎模型的深度特徵損失函數、感知損失和邊緣檢測損失函數在視網膜影像生成中的效果。實驗結果顯示，領域特定的深度特徵並未顯著改善自編碼器影像生成效果。令人意外的是，傳統邊緣檢測濾波器在提升合成影像血管結構的清晰度方面表現出色。這項研究為視網膜影像合成提供了新的方向。
applications: 1. **眼科教學與訓練：**醫學院學生可以使用合成的視網膜影像進行學習，練習診斷各種眼科疾病，而無需使用真實病患的影像，保護病人隱私。
2. **AI輔助診斷系統開發：**利用合成的視網膜影像擴充訓練數據集，提升AI診斷系統的準確性和泛化能力，幫助醫生更快速、準確地診斷眼疾。
3. **個性化視力矯正方案：**透過生成模擬不同視網膜結構的影像，協助驗光師設計更精準的隱形眼鏡或雷射手術方案，改善視力矯正效果。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們正在開發一項革命性的技術，利用AI合成高品質的視網膜影像。這不僅能解決醫療數據隱私問題，更能加速眼科AI的發展。想像一下，未來眼科醫生可以利用我們的技術，在幾秒鐘內生成數千張不同病理特徵的視網膜影像，大幅提升診斷效率和準確性。更重要的是，這項技術可以應用於遠程醫療，讓偏遠地區的居民也能獲得高品質的眼科服務。目前市場上缺乏能精準模擬視網膜血管結構的合成影像技術，我們的技術填補了這個空白，具有巨大的市場潛力。我們預計在未來五年內，將這項技術推廣到各大醫院、眼科診所和研究機構，成為眼科AI領域的領導者。現在投資，您將參與一場改變眼科醫療的革命！

title: Fusion of multi-source precipitation records via coordinate-based generative model
summary:
Precipitation remains one of the most challenging climate variables to
observe and predict accurately. Existing datasets face intricate trade-offs:
gauge observations are relatively trustworthy but sparse, satellites provide
global coverage with retrieval uncertainties, and numerical models offer
physical consistency but are biased and computationally intensive. Here we
introduce PRIMER (Precipitation Record Infinite MERging), a deep generative
framework that fuses these complementary sources to produce accurate,
high-resolution, full-coverage precipitation estimates. PRIMER employs a
coordinate-based diffusion model that learns from arbitrary spatial locations
and associated precipitation values, enabling seamless integration of gridded
data and irregular gauge observations. Through two-stage training--first
learning large-scale patterns, then refining with accurate gauge
measurements--PRIMER captures both large-scale climatology and local precision.
Once trained, it can downscale forecasts, interpolate sparse observations, and
correct systematic biases within a principled Bayesian framework. Using gauge
observations as ground truth, PRIMER effectively corrects biases in existing
datasets, yielding statistically significant error reductions at most stations
and furthermore enhancing the spatial coherence of precipitation fields.
Crucially, it generalizes without retraining, correcting biases in operational
forecasts it has never seen. This demonstrates how generative AI can transform
Earth system science by combining imperfect data, providing a scalable solution
for global precipitation monitoring and prediction.
title_zh: 基於坐標生成模型的多源降水記錄融合
summary_zh: 降水量的精確觀測和預測一直是氣候研究的挑戰。現有資料集各有優缺點：地面觀測可靠但稀疏，衛星覆蓋廣泛但準確性不足，數值模型具備物理一致性但有偏差且計算密集。我們提出PRIMER，一種深度生成框架，融合多種互補數據源，產生準確、高解析度、全覆蓋的降水估計。PRIMER採用基於坐標的擴散模型，從任意空間位置和相關降水值中學習，無縫整合網格數據和不規則的地面觀測。PRIMER通過兩階段訓練，先學習大規模模式，再用精確的地面測量進行細化，捕捉大規模氣候和局部精度。訓練後，它可以縮小預報尺度、插值稀疏觀測，並在貝葉斯框架內校正系統偏差，顯著減少誤差，並提高降水場的空間一致性。更重要的是，它無需重新訓練即可推廣，校正未見過的業務預報中的偏差。PRIMER展示了生成式AI如何通過結合不完善的數據來轉變地球系統科學，為全球降水監測和預測提供可擴展的解決方案。
applications: 農民可以利用更精確的降雨預測來決定何時灌溉農作物，減少不必要的用水，提高農作物產量。
政府可以利用更準確的降雨數據來更好地管理水資源，例如預防乾旱和洪水。
保險公司可以利用更精確的降雨預測來評估與極端天氣事件相關的風險，並制定更合理的保險費率。
pitch: 各位投資人，想像一下，一個能夠精準預測全球每一寸土地降雨量的AI系統，這不再是科幻小說，而是PRIMER正在實現的未來！現有的氣象預報系統，無論是地面站、衛星還是數值模型，都存在局限性，導致預測不夠準確，影響農業、水資源管理、防災等各個領域。PRIMER利用創新的坐標生成模型，整合多種數據來源，克服了這些局限，實現了前所未有的降雨預測精度。這意味著什麼？對於農業，我們可以減少數十億美元的灌溉浪費，提高糧食產量；對於保險業，我們可以更準確地評估風險，降低損失；對於政府，我們可以更有效地應對氣候變化帶來的挑戰。更重要的是，PRIMER的技術具有高度的可擴展性，可以應用於其他地球系統變量的預測，例如溫度、風力等。我們相信，PRIMER將徹底改變地球系統科學，為全球帶來巨大的經濟和社會效益。現在加入我們，共同打造這個價值數十億美元的市場，讓PRIMER成為全球氣象預測的領導者！想像一下，未來PRIMER甚至可以與無人機送水系統結合，實現精準灌溉，徹底解決乾旱問題！

title: Enter: Graduated Realism: A Pedagogical Framework for AI-Powered Avatars in Virtual Reality Teacher Training
summary:
Virtual Reality simulators offer a powerful tool for teacher training, yet
the integration of AI-powered student avatars presents a critical challenge:
determining the optimal level of avatar realism for effective pedagogy. This
literature review examines the evolution of avatar realism in VR teacher
training, synthesizes its theoretical implications, and proposes a new
pedagogical framework to guide future design. Through a systematic review, this
paper traces the progression from human-controlled avatars to generative AI
prototypes. Applying learning theories like Cognitive Load Theory, we argue
that hyper-realism is not always optimal, as high-fidelity avatars can impose
excessive extraneous cognitive load on novices, a stance supported by recent
empirical findings. A significant gap exists between the technological drive
for photorealism and the pedagogical need for scaffolded learning. To address
this gap, we propose Graduated Realism, a framework advocating for starting
trainees with lower-fidelity avatars and progressively increasing behavioral
complexity as skills develop. To make this computationally feasible, we outline
a novel single-call architecture, Crazy Slots, which uses a probabilistic
engine and a Retrieval-Augmented Generation database to generate authentic,
real-time responses without the latency and cost of multi-step reasoning
models. This review provides evidence-based principles for designing the next
generation of AI simulators, arguing that a pedagogically grounded approach to
realism is essential for creating scalable and effective teacher education
tools.
title_zh: 進階式真實：虛擬實境教師培訓中人工智慧頭像的教學框架
summary_zh: 本研究探討在虛擬實境教師培訓中使用人工智慧學生頭像時，如何決定最佳的頭像真實度。我們提出「進階式真實」框架，主張從低真實度頭像開始，隨著教師技能提升，逐步增加頭像的行為複雜度。過度追求寫實可能造成新手認知負擔過重。為降低運算成本，我們設計了「瘋狂插槽」架構，利用機率引擎和檢索增強生成資料庫，即時產生真實回應。本研究為下一代人工智慧教師培訓模擬器的設計，提供了基於實證的原則，強調以教學為本的真實度對於創建可擴展且有效的教師培訓工具至關重要。
applications: 想像一下，未來學開車不用真車，而是透過VR，AI教練一開始是卡通人物，等你技術熟練了，教練就會變成更逼真的虛擬人，讓你更有真實感，也更安全。
語言學習也能用上這技術！剛開始跟可愛的AI角色練習簡單對話，等你進步了，AI角色會變成更像真人、更會講道地口音的外國人，讓你彷彿身歷其境。
醫生訓練也能更有效率！實習醫生可以先跟比較簡單的AI病人練習，等到熟練了，AI病人就會出現更複雜的病症和情緒反應，讓他們在真實面對病人前更有準備。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們正在打造的是下一代的教育訓練平台！傳統的VR教學，擬真度越高成本越高，效果也未必最好。我們的「進階式真實」技術，能根據學習者的程度，動態調整AI頭像的真實度，大幅降低成本，同時提升學習效果。想像一下，未來各行各業的培訓，從醫療、教育到客服，都能透過我們的平台，用更低的成本、更高的效率，培養出更優秀的人才。這是一個數十億美元的市場，而我們擁有領先的技術和創新的商業模式，絕對能為各位帶來豐厚的回報！我們不僅僅是提供技術，更是重新定義未來的教育方式，讓人人都能在最適合自己的環境下學習和成長。現在投資我們，就是投資教育的未來！

title: Quizzard@INOVA Challenge 2025 -- Track A: Plug-and-Play Technique in Interleaved Multi-Image Model
summary:
This paper addresses two main objectives. Firstly, we demonstrate the
impressive performance of the LLaVA-NeXT-interleave on 22 datasets across three
different tasks: Multi-Image Reasoning, Documents and Knowledge-Based
Understanding and Interactive Multi-Modal Communication. Secondly, we add the
Dense Channel Integration (DCI) connector to the LLaVA-NeXT-Interleave and
compare its performance against the standard model. We find that the standard
model achieves the highest overall accuracy, excelling in vision-heavy tasks
like VISION, NLVR2, and Fashion200K. Meanwhile, the DCI-enhanced version shows
particular strength on datasets requiring deeper semantic coherence or
structured change understanding such as MIT-States_PropertyCoherence and
SlideVQA. Our results highlight the potential of combining powerful foundation
models with plug-and-play techniques for Interleave tasks. The code is
available at https://github.com/dinhvietcuong1996/icme25-inova.
title_zh: Quizzard@INOVA Challenge 2025 -- Track A：交錯式多圖像模型中的隨插即用技術
summary_zh: 本研究展示了LLaVA-NeXT-interleave模型在多圖像推理、文件和知識理解、以及互動式多模態溝通等22個數據集上的卓越表現。同時，我們將密集通道整合（DCI）連接器加入LLaVA-NeXT-Interleave模型，並與標準模型進行比較。結果顯示，標準模型在視覺任務（如VISION、NLVR2、Fashion200K）中表現最佳，而DCI增強版本則在需要更深層次的語義連貫性或結構化變更理解的數據集（如MIT-States_PropertyCoherence和SlideVQA）上展現出優勢。研究強調了將強大的基礎模型與隨插即用技術相結合的潛力，以解決交錯式任務。
applications: **智慧旅遊導覽：**想像一下，你到一個新的城市旅遊，只要用手機拍下多張不同角度的建築物照片，AI就能快速整合這些圖像，提供建築物的詳細資訊、歷史背景，甚至推薦附近的餐廳和景點，就像一個隨身的智慧導遊。
**遠距醫療診斷：**醫生可以透過患者上傳的多張患部照片，AI模型分析這些影像，並結合病歷資料，協助醫生更精準地判斷病情，提供更有效的治療方案，尤其在偏遠地區或醫療資源不足的地方，這項技術更顯重要。
**線上購物體驗升級：**消費者在網路上購買家具時，可以上傳多張房間照片，AI模型會自動將家具合成到房間照片中，讓消費者更直觀地看到家具擺放在家中的效果，提升購物體驗，降低退貨率。
pitch: 各位創投先進，我們正在打造一個圖像理解的未來！想像一下，一個AI模型能像人類一樣，整合多張圖片，理解場景、物件之間的複雜關係。我們的LLaVA-NeXT-interleave模型，搭配獨家的隨插即用技術，讓AI圖像理解能力大幅提升！這不僅僅是技術，更是未來各行各業的變革引擎。在智慧城市，它可以優化交通流量；在工業製造，它可以提升產品檢測效率；在零售業，它可以打造前所未有的個性化購物體驗。更重要的是，我們已經證明了DCI連接器能有效提升模型在特定任務上的表現，這意味著我們可以針對不同行業的需求，客製化AI解決方案。這是一個千億美元級別的市場，而我們正站在浪潮之巔。現在加入我們，一起開創AI圖像理解的新紀元！

title: Robust Filtering -- Novel Statistical Learning and Inference Algorithms with Applications
summary:
State estimation or filtering serves as a fundamental task to enable
intelligent decision-making in applications such as autonomous vehicles,
robotics, healthcare monitoring, smart grids, intelligent transportation, and
predictive maintenance. Standard filtering assumes prior knowledge of noise
statistics to extract latent system states from noisy sensor data. However,
real-world scenarios involve abnormalities like outliers, biases, drifts, and
missing observations with unknown or partially known statistics, limiting
conventional approaches. This thesis presents novel robust nonlinear filtering
methods to mitigate these challenges. Based on insights from our filtering
proposals, we extend the formulations to offline estimation/learning setups and
propose smoothing extensions. Our methods leverage Bayesian inference
frameworks, employing both deterministic and stochastic approximation
techniques including Variational Inference (VI) and Particle Filters/Sequential
Monte Carlo (SMC). We also study theoretical estimation limits using Bayesian
Cram\'er-Rao bounds (BCRBs) in the context of measurement abnormalities. To
validate the performance gains of the proposed methods, we perform simulations
and experiments in scenarios including target tracking, indoor localization, 3D
point cloud registration, mesh registration, and pose graph optimization. The
fundamental nature of the work makes it useful in diverse applications, with
possible future extensions toward developing outlier-robust machine learning
pipelines, learning system dynamics from anomalous data, and addressing
challenges in generative AI where standard diffusion models struggle with
outliers, imbalanced datasets, and mode collapse.
title_zh: 穩健濾波：具應用之新型統計學習與推論演算法
summary_zh: 本研究提出新型穩健非線性濾波方法，旨在解決現實世界中常見的異常數據問題，如離群值、偏差、漂移和缺失值。傳統濾波方法依賴對雜訊統計的先驗知識，但現實情況往往難以滿足。本研究基於貝氏推論框架，結合變分推論和粒子濾波等技術，並利用貝氏克拉美羅下界研究了量測異常下的估計極限。透過目標追蹤、室內定位、3D點雲配準等模擬與實驗，驗證了所提出方法的效能提升。此研究可廣泛應用於各領域，並有望擴展至開發穩健的機器學習流程、從異常數據中學習系統動態，以及解決生成式AI中擴散模型在處理離群值、不平衡數據和模式崩潰時所遇到的挑戰。
applications: 想像一下，你的無人機在複雜環境中飛行，即使遇到強風或GPS訊號不穩定，也能準確導航，安全返航，這就是穩健濾波技術的功勞。
智慧手錶能更準確地監測你的心率，即使你在劇烈運動或環境嘈雜的情況下，也能提供可靠的健康數據，幫助你更好地管理健康。
自動駕駛汽車在惡劣天氣或感測器故障的情況下，仍然能夠安全行駛，避免事故發生，保障你的出行安全。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們正在開發一項革命性的技術，它能讓機器在充滿雜訊和異常數據的現實世界中更加聰明可靠。想像一下，自動駕駛不再害怕惡劣天氣，機器人可以在複雜環境中穩定工作，醫療設備能夠提供更精準的診斷。我們的穩健濾波技術，就像是AI的免疫系統，能讓它抵抗各種干擾，保證穩定運行。這不僅僅是一項技術，更是一個龐大的市場機會，涵蓋自動駕駛、機器人、醫療健康、工業自動化等領域。隨著AI應用的普及，對穩健性的需求將會爆炸式增長，而我們正是這個領域的領跑者。我們有信心，這項技術將會顛覆現有產業，創造巨大的商業價值。現在投資，您將成為這場AI革命的早期參與者，共同分享未來的豐厚回報！

title: Towards a Cascaded LLM Framework for Cost-effective Human-AI Decision-Making
summary:
Effective human-AI decision-making balances three key factors: the
\textit{correctness} of predictions, the \textit{cost} of knowledge and
reasoning complexity, and the confidence about whether to \textit{abstain}
automated answers or involve human experts. In this work, we present a cascaded
LLM decision framework that adaptively delegates tasks across multiple tiers of
expertise -- a base model for initial candidate answers, a more capable and
knowledgeable (but costlier) large model, and a human expert for when the model
cascade abstains. Our method proceeds in two stages. First, a deferral policy
determines whether to accept the base model's answer or regenerate it with the
large model based on the confidence score. Second, an abstention policy decides
whether the cascade model response is sufficiently certain or requires human
intervention. Moreover, we incorporate an online learning mechanism in the
framework that can leverage human feedback to improve decision quality over
time. We demonstrate this approach to general question-answering (ARC-Easy and
ARC-Challenge) and medical question-answering (MedQA and MedMCQA). Our results
show that our cascaded strategy outperforms in most cases single-model
baselines in accuracy while reducing cost and providing a principled way to
handle abstentions.
title_zh: 邁向具成本效益之人機協作決策的級聯式大型語言模型框架
summary_zh: 本研究提出一個級聯式大型語言模型決策框架，旨在平衡預測的準確性、知識與推理複雜性的成本，以及決定是否放棄自動回覆或引入人類專家的信心度。此框架包含多個專業層級：基礎模型提供初步候選答案；更強大、知識更豐富（但成本更高）的大型模型進行再生成；以及在模型放棄時介入的人類專家。透過遞延策略決定是否接受基礎模型的答案或使用大型模型重新生成，並透過棄權策略判斷級聯模型的回應是否足夠確定，或需要人工介入。此外，框架還整合了線上學習機制，可利用人類回饋來提升決策品質。在通用問答和醫學問答的實驗中，結果表明此級聯策略在大多數情況下，在準確性方面優於單一模型，同時降低了成本，並提供了一種處理棄權的有效方法。
applications: **智慧客服：** 當客戶提出複雜或專業問題時，系統會先由基礎AI模型回答，若無法處理則轉由更強大的AI模型，最後才轉給真人客服，節省人力成本並提升效率。

title: Brain Network Analysis Based on Fine-tuned Self-supervised Model for Brain Disease Diagnosis
summary:
Functional brain network analysis has become an indispensable tool for brain
disease analysis. It is profoundly impacted by deep learning methods, which can
characterize complex connections between ROIs. However, the research on
foundation models of brain network is limited and constrained to a single
dimension, which restricts their extensive application in neuroscience. In this
study, we propose a fine-tuned brain network model for brain disease diagnosis.
It expands brain region representations across multiple dimensions based on the
original brain network model, thereby enhancing its generalizability. Our model
consists of two key modules: (1)an adapter module that expands brain region
features across different dimensions. (2)a fine-tuned foundation brain network
model, based on self-supervised learning and pre-trained on fMRI data from
thousands of participants. Specifically, its transformer block is able to
effectively extract brain region features and compute the inter-region
associations. Moreover, we derive a compact latent representation of the brain
network for brain disease diagnosis. Our downstream experiments in this study
demonstrate that the proposed model achieves superior performance in brain
disease diagnosis, which potentially offers a promising approach in brain
network analysis research.
title_zh: 基於微調自監督模型的大腦網路分析於腦部疾病診斷之應用
summary_zh: 本研究提出一個微調後的大腦網路模型，用於腦部疾病診斷。此模型基於自監督學習，並利用數千名受試者的fMRI數據進行預訓練，能有效提取大腦區域特徵並計算區域間的關聯性。模型包含一個適配器模組，用於擴展不同維度的大腦區域特徵，增強其泛化能力。實驗結果表明，該模型在腦部疾病診斷方面表現出色，為大腦網路分析研究提供了一個有潛力的方向。簡而言之，這是一個更精準、更有效率的腦部疾病診斷工具。

title: Foundation Models in Autonomous Driving: A Survey on Scenario Generation and Scenario Analysis
summary:
For autonomous vehicles, safe navigation in complex environments depends on
handling a broad range of diverse and rare driving scenarios. Simulation- and
scenario-based testing have emerged as key approaches to development and
validation of autonomous driving systems. Traditional scenario generation
relies on rule-based systems, knowledge-driven models, and data-driven
synthesis, often producing limited diversity and unrealistic safety-critical
cases. With the emergence of foundation models, which represent a new
generation of pre-trained, general-purpose AI models, developers can process
heterogeneous inputs (e.g., natural language, sensor data, HD maps, and control
actions), enabling the synthesis and interpretation of complex driving
scenarios. In this paper, we conduct a survey about the application of
foundation models for scenario generation and scenario analysis in autonomous
driving (as of May 2025). Our survey presents a unified taxonomy that includes
large language models, vision-language models, multimodal large language
models, diffusion models, and world models for the generation and analysis of
autonomous driving scenarios. In addition, we review the methodologies,
open-source datasets, simulation platforms, and benchmark challenges, and we
examine the evaluation metrics tailored explicitly to scenario generation and
analysis. Finally, the survey concludes by highlighting the open challenges and
research questions, and outlining promising future research directions. All
reviewed papers are listed in a continuously maintained repository, which
contains supplementary materials and is available at
https://github.com/TUM-AVS/FM-for-Scenario-Generation-Analysis.
title_zh: 自動駕駛中的基礎模型：場景生成與場景分析綜述
summary_zh: 本研究綜述了基礎模型在自動駕駛場景生成與分析中的應用。傳統方法在生成多樣且真實的安全關鍵場景方面存在局限。而新一代預訓練通用AI模型——基礎模型，能處理自然語言、感測器數據、高清地圖等多模態輸入，從而合成和解讀複雜駕駛場景。本研究建立統一的分類體系，涵蓋大型語言模型、視覺語言模型、多模態大型語言模型、擴散模型和世界模型，並回顧了方法、數據集、模擬平台和評估指標，最後探討了未來的研究方向和挑戰。相關論文列表將持續更新。

title: Towards a Cascaded LLM Framework for Cost-effective Human-AI Decision-Making
summary:
Effective human-AI decision-making balances three key factors: the
\textit{correctness} of predictions, the \textit{cost} of knowledge and
reasoning complexity, and the confidence about whether to \textit{abstain}
automated answers or involve human experts. In this work, we present a cascaded
LLM decision framework that adaptively delegates tasks across multiple tiers of
expertise -- a base model for initial candidate answers, a more capable and
knowledgeable (but costlier) large model, and a human expert for when the model
cascade abstains. Our method proceeds in two stages. First, a deferral policy
determines whether to accept the base model's answer or regenerate it with the
large model based on the confidence score. Second, an abstention policy decides
whether the cascade model response is sufficiently certain or requires human
intervention. Moreover, we incorporate an online learning mechanism in the
framework that can leverage human feedback to improve decision quality over
time. We demonstrate this approach to general question-answering (ARC-Easy and
ARC-Challenge) and medical question-answering (MedQA and MedMCQA). Our results
show that our cascaded strategy outperforms in most cases single-model
baselines in accuracy while reducing cost and providing a principled way to
handle abstentions.
title_zh: 邁向具成本效益之人機協作決策之級聯式大型語言模型框架

title: Generative Representational Learning of Foundation Models for Recommendation
summary:
Developing a single foundation model with the capability to excel across
diverse tasks has been a long-standing objective in the field of artificial
intelligence. As the wave of general-purpose foundation models sweeps across
various domains, their influence has significantly extended to the field of
recommendation systems. While recent efforts have explored recommendation
foundation models for various generative tasks, they often overlook crucial
embedding tasks and struggle with the complexities of multi-task learning,
including knowledge sharing & conflict resolution, and convergence speed
inconsistencies. To address these limitations, we introduce RecFound, a
generative representational learning framework for recommendation foundation
models. We construct the first comprehensive dataset for recommendation
foundation models covering both generative and embedding tasks across diverse
scenarios. Based on this dataset, we propose a novel multi-task training scheme
featuring a Task-wise Mixture of Low-rank Experts (TMoLE) to handle knowledge
sharing & conflict, a Step-wise Convergence-oriented Sample Scheduler (S2Sched)
to address inconsistent convergence, and a Model Merge module to balance the
performance across tasks. Experiments demonstrate that RecFound achieves
state-of-the-art performance across various recommendation tasks, outperforming
existing baselines.
title_zh: 推薦系統基礎模型的生成式表徵學習
summary_zh: 本研究提出一個名為RecFound的生成式表徵學習框架，旨在打造適用於各種推薦任務的通用基礎模型。現有模型往往忽略了嵌入任務，並且在多任務學習中面臨知識共享、衝突解決以及收斂速度不一致等問題。RecFound透過構建包含生成式和嵌入式任務的綜合數據集，並採用Task-wise Mixture of Low-rank Experts (TMoLE)處理知識共享，Step-wise Convergence-oriented Sample Scheduler (S2Sched)解決收斂問題，以及Model Merge模組平衡任務性能，顯著提升了推薦系統的效能，在多項任務中超越了現有模型。

title: Taming Stable Diffusion for Computed Tomography Blind Super-Resolution
summary:
High-resolution computed tomography (CT) imaging is essential for medical
diagnosis but requires increased radiation exposure, creating a critical
trade-off between image quality and patient safety. While deep learning methods
have shown promise in CT super-resolution, they face challenges with complex
degradations and limited medical training data. Meanwhile, large-scale
pre-trained diffusion models, particularly Stable Diffusion, have demonstrated
remarkable capabilities in synthesizing fine details across various vision
tasks. Motivated by this, we propose a novel framework that adapts Stable
Diffusion for CT blind super-resolution. We employ a practical degradation
model to synthesize realistic low-quality images and leverage a pre-trained
vision-language model to generate corresponding descriptions. Subsequently, we
perform super-resolution using Stable Diffusion with a specialized controlling
strategy, conditioned on both low-resolution inputs and the generated text
descriptions. Extensive experiments show that our method outperforms existing
approaches, demonstrating its potential for achieving high-quality CT imaging
at reduced radiation doses. Our code will be made publicly available.
title_zh: 馴服 Stable Diffusion 以進行電腦斷層掃描盲超解析度
summary_zh: 高解析度電腦斷層掃描(CT)對醫療診斷至關重要，但會增加輻射暴露，造成影像品質與患者安全之間的權衡。深度學習在CT超解析度方面展現潛力，但面臨複雜降級和有限醫療數據的挑戰。本研究提出一個新穎框架，調整Stable Diffusion用於CT盲超解析度。利用實際降級模型合成真實的低品質圖像，並利用預訓練的視覺語言模型生成相應的描述。然後，使用Stable Diffusion進行超解析度，並採用特殊控制策略，以低解析度輸入和生成的文本描述為條件。實驗證明，該方法優於現有方法，展現了以較低輻射劑量實現高品質CT成像的潛力。
applications: 想像一下，醫院的CT掃描儀可以通過這個技術，在不增加輻射劑量的前提下，生成更清晰的圖像，讓醫生能更準確地診斷病情，特別是對於需要多次掃描的病人，像是癌症患者，可以有效降低他們接受的總輻射量。
這項技術也能應用於動物醫療。獸醫在使用CT掃描動物時，可以降低輻射劑量，同時獲得清晰的影像，減少對寵物的潛在傷害。
在機場安檢方面，如果能將這項技術應用於X光掃描，就能在不增加輻射暴露的前提下，更清晰地辨識行李中的可疑物品，提升安檢效率與安全性。

title: AI reconstruction of European weather from the Euro-Atlantic regimes
summary:
We present a non-linear AI-model designed to reconstruct monthly mean
anomalies of the European temperature and precipitation based on the
Euro-Atlantic Weather regimes (WR) indices. WR represent recurrent,
quasi-stationary, and persistent states of the atmospheric circulation that
exert considerable influence over the European weather, therefore offering an
opportunity for sub-seasonal to seasonal forecasting. While much research has
focused on studying the correlation and impacts of the WR on European weather,
the estimation of ground-level climate variables, such as temperature and
precipitation, from Euro-Atlantic WR remains largely unexplored and is
currently limited to linear methods. The presented AI model can capture and
introduce complex non-linearities in the relation between the WR indices,
describing the state of the Euro-Atlantic atmospheric circulation and the
corresponding surface temperature and precipitation anomalies in Europe. We
discuss the AI-model performance in reconstructing the monthly mean two-meter
temperature and total precipitation anomalies in the European winter and
summer, also varying the number of WR used to describe the monthly atmospheric
circulation. We assess the impact of errors on the WR indices in the
reconstruction and show that a mean absolute relative error below 80% yields
improved seasonal reconstruction compared to the ECMWF operational seasonal
forecast system, SEAS5. As a demonstration of practical applicability, we
evaluate the model using WR indices predicted by SEAS5, finding slightly better
or comparable skill relative to the SEAS5 forecast itself. Our findings
demonstrate that WR-based anomaly reconstruction, powered by AI tools, offers a
promising pathway for sub-seasonal and seasonal forecasting.
title_zh: 基於歐亞-大西洋天氣模態的人工智慧歐洲天氣重建
summary_zh: 本研究提出一種非線性人工智慧模型，利用歐亞-大西洋天氣模態（WR）指數，重建歐洲月平均氣溫和降水異常。天氣模態代表大氣環流中重複出現、準靜止且持續的狀態，對歐洲天氣有顯著影響，為次季節到季節預測提供機會。該AI模型能捕捉天氣模態指數與歐洲地表氣溫和降水異常之間複雜的非線性關係。實驗證明，即使天氣模態指數存在誤差，該模型在重建歐洲冬夏季月平均氣溫和降水方面，仍優於歐洲中期天氣預報中心(ECMWF)的SEAS5季節預報系統。這項研究展示了基於天氣模態並由人工智慧驅動的異常重建，為次季節和季節預測提供了一條有前景的途徑。

title: Touch begins where vision ends: Generalizable policies for contact-rich manipulation
summary:
Data-driven approaches struggle with precise manipulation; imitation learning
requires many hard-to-obtain demonstrations, while reinforcement learning
yields brittle, non-generalizable policies. We introduce VisuoTactile Local
(ViTaL) policy learning, a framework that solves fine-grained manipulation
tasks by decomposing them into two phases: a reaching phase, where a
vision-language model (VLM) enables scene-level reasoning to localize the
object of interest, and a local interaction phase, where a reusable,
scene-agnostic ViTaL policy performs contact-rich manipulation using egocentric
vision and tactile sensing. This approach is motivated by the observation that
while scene context varies, the low-level interaction remains consistent across
task instances. By training local policies once in a canonical setting, they
can generalize via a localize-then-execute strategy. ViTaL achieves around 90%
success on contact-rich tasks in unseen environments and is robust to
distractors. ViTaL's effectiveness stems from three key insights: (1)
foundation models for segmentation enable training robust visual encoders via
behavior cloning; (2) these encoders improve the generalizability of policies
learned using residual RL; and (3) tactile sensing significantly boosts
performance in contact-rich tasks. Ablation studies validate each of these
insights, and we demonstrate that ViTaL integrates well with high-level VLMs,
enabling robust, reusable low-level skills. Results and videos are available at
https://vitalprecise.github.io.
title_zh: 觸覺始於視覺之終點：接觸豐富操作的通用策略
summary_zh: 本研究提出VisuoTactile Local (ViTaL) 策略學習框架，解決精細操作任務。ViTaL將任務分解為兩個階段：首先，利用視覺語言模型 (VLM) 進行場景級推理，定位目標物體；接著，使用自我中心的視覺和觸覺感測，執行可重複使用的、與場景無關的ViTaL策略，進行接觸豐富的操作。ViTaL的核心理念是，雖然場景背景多變，但底層互動在不同任務實例中保持一致。透過在標準設定中一次性訓練局部策略，ViTaL就能透過「定位-執行」策略進行泛化。實驗證明，ViTaL在未見過的環境中，接觸豐富任務的成功率約為90%，並且對干擾物具有魯棒性。ViTaL的有效性來自於三個關鍵洞見：(1) 用於分割的基礎模型能夠透過行為克隆訓練出強大的視覺編碼器；(2) 這些編碼器提高了使用殘差強化學習所學策略的泛化能力；(3) 觸覺感測顯著提升了接觸豐富任務的性能。

title: Diagnosing and Improving Diffusion Models by Estimating the Optimal Loss Value
summary:
Diffusion models have achieved remarkable success in generative modeling.
Despite more stable training, the loss of diffusion models is not indicative of
absolute data-fitting quality, since its optimal value is typically not zero
but unknown, leading to confusion between large optimal loss and insufficient
model capacity. In this work, we advocate the need to estimate the optimal loss
value for diagnosing and improving diffusion models. We first derive the
optimal loss in closed form under a unified formulation of diffusion models,
and develop effective estimators for it, including a stochastic variant
scalable to large datasets with proper control of variance and bias. With this
tool, we unlock the inherent metric for diagnosing the training quality of
mainstream diffusion model variants, and develop a more performant training
schedule based on the optimal loss. Moreover, using models with 120M to 1.5B
parameters, we find that the power law is better demonstrated after subtracting
the optimal loss from the actual training loss, suggesting a more principled
setting for investigating the scaling law for diffusion models.
title_zh: 藉由估計最佳損失值來診斷與改進擴散模型
summary_zh: 擴散模型在生成模型領域表現出色，但其損失函數的最佳值通常非零且未知，容易誤判為模型能力不足。本研究提倡估計最佳損失值，以診斷和改進擴散模型。我們推導出統一擴散模型公式下的最佳損失閉合形式，並開發有效的估計器，包含可擴展至大型數據集的隨機變體，同時控制方差和偏差。藉此，我們解鎖了診斷主流擴散模型訓練品質的內在指標，並基於最佳損失開發了更高效的訓練排程。使用參數量從1.2億到15億的模型，我們發現從實際訓練損失中減去最佳損失後，冪律關係更為明顯，為研究擴散模型的縮放定律提供了一個更具原則性的設定。

title: MARCO: Hardware-Aware Neural Architecture Search for Edge Devices with Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning and Conformal Prediction Filtering
summary:
This paper introduces MARCO (Multi-Agent Reinforcement learning with
Conformal Optimization), a novel hardware-aware framework for efficient neural
architecture search (NAS) targeting resource-constrained edge devices. By
significantly reducing search time and maintaining accuracy under strict
hardware constraints, MARCO bridges the gap between automated DNN design and
CAD for edge AI deployment. MARCO's core technical contribution lies in its
unique combination of multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) with Conformal
Prediction (CP) to accelerate the hardware/software co-design process for
deploying deep neural networks. Unlike conventional once-for-all (OFA) supernet
approaches that require extensive pretraining, MARCO decomposes the NAS task
into a hardware configuration agent (HCA) and a Quantization Agent (QA). The
HCA optimizes high-level design parameters, while the QA determines per-layer
bit-widths under strict memory and latency budgets using a shared reward signal
within a centralized-critic, decentralized-execution (CTDE) paradigm. A key
innovation is the integration of a calibrated CP surrogate model that provides
statistical guarantees (with a user-defined miscoverage rate) to prune
unpromising candidate architectures before incurring the high costs of partial
training or hardware simulation. This early filtering drastically reduces the
search space while ensuring that high-quality designs are retained with a high
probability. Extensive experiments on MNIST, CIFAR-10, and CIFAR-100
demonstrate that MARCO achieves a 3-4x reduction in total search time compared
to an OFA baseline while maintaining near-baseline accuracy (within 0.3%).
Furthermore, MARCO also reduces inference latency. Validation on a MAX78000
evaluation board confirms that simulator trends hold in practice, with
simulator estimates deviating from measured values by less than 5%.
title_zh: MARCO：基於多代理人強化學習與適應性預測過濾的邊緣設備硬體感知神經架構搜尋
summary_zh: MARCO是一個針對資源受限的邊緣設備所設計的硬體感知神經網路架構搜尋框架。它結合了多代理人強化學習與適應性預測，加速硬體/軟體協同設計，無需大量預訓練。MARCO將搜尋任務分解為硬體配置代理人和量化代理人，前者優化高階設計參數，後者在嚴格的記憶體和延遲預算下決定每層的位元寬度。適應性預測模型能提供統計保證，過濾掉不具潛力的候選架構，大幅減少搜尋空間。實驗證明，MARCO在保持精度的前提下，可將搜尋時間縮短3-4倍，並降低推論延遲。在MAX78000評估板上的驗證結果也證實了模擬器的準確性。

title: OTFusion: Bridging Vision-only and Vision-Language Models via Optimal Transport for Transductive Zero-Shot Learning
summary:
Transductive zero-shot learning (ZSL) aims to classify unseen categories by
leveraging both semantic class descriptions and the distribution of unlabeled
test data. While Vision-Language Models (VLMs) such as CLIP excel at aligning
visual inputs with textual semantics, they often rely too heavily on
class-level priors and fail to capture fine-grained visual cues. In contrast,
Vision-only Foundation Models (VFMs) like DINOv2 provide rich perceptual
features but lack semantic alignment. To exploit the complementary strengths of
these models, we propose OTFusion, a simple yet effective training-free
framework that bridges VLMs and VFMs via Optimal Transport. Specifically,
OTFusion aims to learn a shared probabilistic representation that aligns visual
and semantic information by minimizing the transport cost between their
respective distributions. This unified distribution enables coherent class
predictions that are both semantically meaningful and visually grounded.
Extensive experiments on 11 benchmark datasets demonstrate that OTFusion
consistently outperforms the original CLIP model, achieving an average accuracy
improvement of nearly $10\%$, all without any fine-tuning or additional
annotations. The code will be publicly released after the paper is accepted.
title_zh: OTFusion：透過最佳傳輸橋接純視覺與視覺語言模型，實現轉導式零樣本學習
summary_zh: 這項研究提出OTFusion，一個免訓練的框架，旨在橋接純視覺模型（例如DINOv2）和視覺語言模型（例如CLIP）。OTFusion利用最佳傳輸理論，學習一個共享的機率表示，對齊視覺和語義資訊，從而結合兩者的優勢。純視覺模型擅長提供豐富的感知特徵，但缺乏語義對齊；視覺語言模型則擅長對齊視覺輸入和文本語義，但可能過於依賴類別先驗知識。OTFusion透過最小化視覺和語義分布之間的傳輸成本，實現連貫的類別預測，兼具語義意義和視覺基礎。實驗結果顯示，OTFusion在多個基準數據集上超越了原始CLIP模型，平均準確度提升近10%。

title: VideoPDE: Unified Generative PDE Solving via Video Inpainting Diffusion Models
summary:
We present a unified framework for solving partial differential equations
(PDEs) using video-inpainting diffusion transformer models. Unlike existing
methods that devise specialized strategies for either forward or inverse
problems under full or partial observation, our approach unifies these tasks
under a single, flexible generative framework. Specifically, we recast
PDE-solving as a generalized inpainting problem, e.g., treating forward
prediction as inferring missing spatiotemporal information of future states
from initial conditions. To this end, we design a transformer-based
architecture that conditions on arbitrary patterns of known data to infer
missing values across time and space. Our method proposes pixel-space video
diffusion models for fine-grained, high-fidelity inpainting and conditioning,
while enhancing computational efficiency through hierarchical modeling.
Extensive experiments show that our video inpainting-based diffusion model
offers an accurate and versatile solution across a wide range of PDEs and
problem setups, outperforming state-of-the-art baselines.
title_zh: VideoPDE：透過影片修復擴散模型實現統一的生成式偏微分方程式求解
summary_zh: 本研究提出一個統一的框架，利用影片修復擴散轉換器模型來求解偏微分方程式。不同於以往針對完整或部分觀測下的正向或反向問題設計專用策略，我們的架構將這些任務統一在一個靈活的生成式框架下。我們將偏微分方程式求解重新定義為廣義的修復問題，例如將正向預測視為從初始條件推斷未來狀態的缺失時空訊息。我們設計了一個基於轉換器的架構，可以根據已知資料的任意模式來推斷時間和空間上的缺失值。我們的像素空間影片擴散模型提供精確、高保真度的修復和條件設定，並透過分層建模提高計算效率。大量實驗表明，我們的模型在廣泛的偏微分方程式和問題設置中，提供準確且通用的解決方案，優於目前最先進的基準。

title: Kolmogorov-Arnold Network for Gene Regulatory Network Inference
summary:
Gene regulation is central to understanding cellular processes and
development, potentially leading to the discovery of new treatments for
diseases and personalized medicine. Inferring gene regulatory networks (GRNs)
from single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data presents significant
challenges due to its high dimensionality and complexity. Existing tree-based
models, such as GENIE3 and GRNBOOST2, demonstrated scalability and
explainability in GRN inference, but they cannot distinguish regulation types
nor effectively capture continuous cellular dynamics. In this paper, we
introduce scKAN, a novel model that employs a Kolmogorov-Arnold network (KAN)
with explainable AI to infer GRNs from scRNA-seq data. By modeling gene
expression as differentiable functions matching the smooth nature of cellular
dynamics, scKAN can accurately and precisely detect activation and inhibition
regulations through explainable AI and geometric tools. We conducted extensive
experiments on the BEELINE benchmark, and scKAN surpasses and improves the
leading signed GRN inference models ranging from 5.40\% to 28.37\% in AUROC and
from 1.97\% to 40.45\% in AUPRC. These results highlight the potential of scKAN
in capturing the underlying biological processes in gene regulation without
prior knowledge of the graph structure.
title_zh: 基於 Kolmogorov-Arnold 網絡的基因調控網絡推斷

title: CAMS: A CityGPT-Powered Agentic Framework for Urban Human Mobility Simulation
summary:
Human mobility simulation plays a crucial role in various real-world
applications. Recently, to address the limitations of traditional data-driven
approaches, researchers have explored leveraging the commonsense knowledge and
reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs) to accelerate human
mobility simulation. However, these methods suffer from several critical
shortcomings, including inadequate modeling of urban spaces and poor
integration with both individual mobility patterns and collective mobility
distributions. To address these challenges, we propose \textbf{C}ityGPT-Powered
\textbf{A}gentic framework for \textbf{M}obility \textbf{S}imulation
(\textbf{CAMS}), an agentic framework that leverages the language based urban
foundation model to simulate human mobility in urban space. \textbf{CAMS}
comprises three core modules, including MobExtractor to extract template
mobility patterns and synthesize new ones based on user profiles, GeoGenerator
to generate anchor points considering collective knowledge and generate
candidate urban geospatial knowledge using an enhanced version of CityGPT,
TrajEnhancer to retrieve spatial knowledge based on mobility patterns and
generate trajectories with real trajectory preference alignment via DPO.
Experiments on real-world datasets show that \textbf{CAMS} achieves superior
performance without relying on externally provided geospatial information.
Moreover, by holistically modeling both individual mobility patterns and
collective mobility constraints, \textbf{CAMS} generates more realistic and
plausible trajectories. In general, \textbf{CAMS} establishes a new paradigm
that integrates the agentic framework with urban-knowledgeable LLMs for human
mobility simulation.
title_zh: CAMS：一個以 CityGPT 驅動的代理框架，用於城市人類移動模擬

title: MultiViT2: A Data-augmented Multimodal Neuroimaging Prediction Framework via Latent Diffusion Model
summary:
Multimodal medical imaging integrates diverse data types, such as structural
and functional neuroimaging, to provide complementary insights that enhance
deep learning predictions and improve outcomes. This study focuses on a
neuroimaging prediction framework based on both structural and functional
neuroimaging data. We propose a next-generation prediction model,
\textbf{MultiViT2}, which combines a pretrained representative learning base
model with a vision transformer backbone for prediction output. Additionally,
we developed a data augmentation module based on the latent diffusion model
that enriches input data by generating augmented neuroimaging samples, thereby
enhancing predictive performance through reduced overfitting and improved
generalizability. We show that MultiViT2 significantly outperforms the
first-generation model in schizophrenia classification accuracy and
demonstrates strong scalability and portability.
title_zh: MultiViT2：一個透過潛在擴散模型進行資料增強的多模態神經影像預測框架
summary_zh: 本研究提出一個基於結構性和功能性神經影像資料的神經影像預測框架MultiViT2。此模型結合了預訓練的代表性學習基礎模型與視覺轉換器骨幹，以進行更精準的預測。此外，我們開發了一個基於潛在擴散模型的資料增強模組，透過生成增強的神經影像樣本來豐富輸入資料，從而減少過擬合併提高泛化能力，進而提升預測性能。實驗結果表明，MultiViT2在精神分裂症分類準確度方面顯著優於第一代模型，並展現出強大的可擴展性和可移植性。

title: Attribution-guided Pruning for Compression, Circuit Discovery, and Targeted Correction in LLMs
summary:
Large Language Models (LLMs) are central to many contemporary AI
applications, yet their extensive parameter counts pose significant challenges
for deployment in memory- and compute-constrained environments. Recent works in
eXplainable AI (XAI), particularly on attribution methods, suggest that
interpretability can also enable model compression by identifying and removing
components irrelevant to inference. In this paper, we leverage Layer-wise
Relevance Propagation (LRP) to perform attribution-guided pruning of LLMs.
While LRP has shown promise in structured pruning for vision models, we extend
it to unstructured pruning in LLMs and demonstrate that it can substantially
reduce model size with minimal performance loss. Our method is especially
effective in extracting task-relevant subgraphs -- so-called ``circuits'' --
which can represent core functions (e.g., indirect object identification).
Building on this, we introduce a technique for model correction, by selectively
removing circuits responsible for spurious behaviors (e.g., toxic outputs). All
in all, we gather these techniques as a uniform holistic framework and showcase
its effectiveness and limitations through extensive experiments for
compression, circuit discovery and model correction on Llama and OPT models,
highlighting its potential for improving both model efficiency and safety. Our
code is publicly available at https://github.com/erfanhatefi/SparC3.
title_zh: 歸因導向剪枝：用於LLM的壓縮、電路發現和目標校正
summary_zh: 大型語言模型（LLM）雖然強大，但體積龐大，難以在資源有限的環境中使用。本研究利用Layer-wise Relevance Propagation (LRP) 進行歸因分析，找出模型中不重要的部分並進行剪枝，從而壓縮LLM。此方法能有效提取執行特定任務的子圖，稱為「電路」，代表核心功能。更進一步，我們還能移除產生不良輸出的電路，例如有毒言論，以修正模型。實驗證明，此框架在壓縮、電路發現和模型校正方面，能有效提升Llama和OPT模型的效率和安全性。
applications: **智慧客服瘦身版：** 現在的智慧客服雖然很聰明，但需要很強大的硬體才能跑得動。用了這個技術，可以把智慧客服模型縮小，讓手機或平板也能順暢運行，隨時隨地提供個人化的服務。
**AI輔助創作精華版：** AI寫作工具越來越流行，但產生內容有時過於冗長。透過這個技術，可以萃取出AI模型中真正重要的部分，讓AI在寫作時更精準、更到位，提供更精簡、更有效的創作輔助。
**安全AI過濾器：** 有些AI模型會產生不當或有害的內容。這個技術可以找出模型中產生這些內容的「壞迴路」，並將其移除，讓AI更安全、更可靠，避免造成負面影響。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們正在開發一項革命性的技術，能大幅縮減大型語言模型（LLM）的體積，同時保持甚至提升其效能。想像一下，我們能將原本需要超級電腦才能運行的AI模型，壓縮到手機上也能流暢運行！這不僅降低了運算成本，也開創了無限商機。我們的技術不僅僅是壓縮，更可以找出模型中的關鍵「電路」，讓我們能精準地修正模型，例如移除產生仇恨言論的部分，打造更安全、更可信賴的AI。這項技術的潛在應用範圍極廣，從個人化的AI助理、高效的企業客服系統，到更安全的AI醫療診斷，都將受益於我們的創新。我們相信，透過我們的技術，AI將不再是少數人的專利，而是能真正普及到每個人的生活之中。現在投資我們，您將站在AI革命的最前線，共同打造一個更智慧、更美好的未來！

title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) at First Glance: Studying the Security and Maintainability of MCP Servers
summary:
Although Foundation Models (FMs), such as GPT-4, are increasingly used in
domains like finance and software engineering, reliance on textual interfaces
limits these models' real-world interaction. To address this, FM providers
introduced tool calling-triggering a proliferation of frameworks with distinct
tool interfaces. In late 2024, Anthropic introduced the Model Context Protocol
(MCP) to standardize this tool ecosystem, which has become the de facto
standard with over eight million weekly SDK downloads. Despite its adoption,
MCP's AI-driven, non-deterministic control flow introduces new risks to
sustainability, security, and maintainability, warranting closer examination.
  Towards this end, we present the first large-scale empirical study of MCP.
Using state-of-the-art health metrics and a hybrid analysis pipeline, combining
a general-purpose static analysis tool with an MCP-specific scanner, we
evaluate 1,899 open-source MCP servers to assess their health, security, and
maintainability. Despite MCP servers demonstrating strong health metrics, we
identify eight distinct vulnerabilities-only three overlapping with traditional
software vulnerabilities. Additionally, 7.2% of servers contain general
vulnerabilities and 5.5% exhibit MCP-specific tool poisoning. Regarding
maintainability, while 66% exhibit code smells, 14.4% contain ten bug patterns
overlapping prior research. These findings highlight the need for MCP-specific
vulnerability detection techniques while reaffirming the value of traditional
analysis and refactoring practices.
title_zh: 模型上下文協定 (MCP) 初探：研究 MCP 伺服器的安全性與可維護性
summary_zh: 大型語言模型（如GPT-4）廣泛應用於金融和軟體工程等領域，但其文字介面限制了現實世界的互動。為了解決這個問題，Anthropic於2024年末推出了模型上下文協定(MCP)，旨在標準化工具生態系統，並迅速成為事實標準，每周SDK下載量超過八百萬次。然而，MCP的AI驅動、非確定性控制流程為可持續性、安全性和可維護性帶來了新的風險。本研究對1899個開源MCP伺服器進行了大規模實證研究，評估其健康狀況、安全性和可維護性。研究發現，雖然MCP伺服器表現出良好的健康指標，但仍存在八種不同的漏洞，其中5.5%的伺服器存在MCP專用的工具中毒風險。研究結果強調了開發MCP專用漏洞檢測技術的必要性，同時重申了傳統分析和重構方法的重要性。
applications: 想像一下，未來你可以直接用語音控制你的智慧家電，像是對著冰箱說：「冰箱，幫我訂購明天早餐需要的牛奶和雞蛋」，而冰箱就能透過MCP協定，自動連接到你常用的生鮮電商平台下單。
假設你是個軟體工程師，你可以使用MCP協定，讓AI助手自動幫你檢查程式碼是否有漏洞，甚至自動修復。例如，你只需說：「AI，幫我檢查這段程式碼的安全性」，AI就能透過MCP連接到安全分析工具，並將結果直接回饋給你。
在醫療領域，醫生可以使用MCP協定，讓AI助手整合病人的所有醫療數據，包括病歷、檢驗報告、影像資料等，快速生成一份完整的病情分析報告，幫助醫生做出更精確的診斷和治療方案。

title: Exploiting the Exact Denoising Posterior Score in Training-Free Guidance of Diffusion Models
summary:
The success of diffusion models has driven interest in performing conditional
sampling via training-free guidance of the denoising process to solve image
restoration and other inverse problems. A popular class of methods, based on
Diffusion Posterior Sampling (DPS), attempts to approximate the intractable
posterior score function directly. In this work, we present a novel expression
for the exact posterior score for purely denoising tasks that is tractable in
terms of the unconditional score function. We leverage this result to analyze
the time-dependent error in the DPS score for denoising tasks and compute step
sizes on the fly to minimize the error at each time step. We demonstrate that
these step sizes are transferable to related inverse problems such as
colorization, random inpainting, and super resolution. Despite its simplicity,
this approach is competitive with state-of-the-art techniques and enables
sampling with fewer time steps than DPS.
title_zh: 利用精確去噪後驗分數實現擴散模型免訓練引導
summary_zh: 本研究提出一種針對擴散模型中去噪任務的全新方法，無需額外訓練即可實現圖像修復等逆問題的條件採樣。傳統方法難以精確計算後驗分數函數，本研究則推導出一個精確的後驗分數表達式，並利用它來分析去噪任務中DPS分數的時變誤差，進而動態調整步長以最小化誤差。實驗證明，這種方法不僅簡單有效，而且可以應用於色彩還原、隨機填補和超分辨率等相關逆問題，並能以更少的步驟實現與最先進技術相媲美的效果。
applications: 老照片修復：可以將模糊不清的老照片變得清晰，還原珍貴回憶。
醫療影像增強：可以提高X光片、CT掃描等醫療影像的清晰度，幫助醫生更準確地診斷病情。
藝術品復原：可以修復受損的畫作或文物，讓它們重現原貌。

title: OneRec Technical Report
summary:
Recommender systems have been widely used in various large-scale
user-oriented platforms for many years. However, compared to the rapid
developments in the AI community, recommendation systems have not achieved a
breakthrough in recent years. For instance, they still rely on a multi-stage
cascaded architecture rather than an end-to-end approach, leading to
computational fragmentation and optimization inconsistencies, and hindering the
effective application of key breakthrough technologies from the AI community in
recommendation scenarios.
  To address these issues, we propose OneRec, which reshapes the recommendation
system through an end-to-end generative approach and achieves promising
results. Firstly, we have enhanced the computational FLOPs of the current
recommendation model by 10 $\times$ and have identified the scaling laws for
recommendations within certain boundaries. Secondly, reinforcement learning
techniques, previously difficult to apply for optimizing recommendations, show
significant potential in this framework. Lastly, through infrastructure
optimizations, we have achieved 23.7% and 28.8% Model FLOPs Utilization (MFU)
on flagship GPUs during training and inference, respectively, aligning closely
with the LLM community. This architecture significantly reduces communication
and storage overhead, resulting in operating expense that is only 10.6% of
traditional recommendation pipelines. Deployed in Kuaishou/Kuaishou Lite APP,
it handles 25% of total queries per second, enhancing overall App Stay Time by
0.54% and 1.24%, respectively. Additionally, we have observed significant
increases in metrics such as 7-day Lifetime, which is a crucial indicator of
recommendation experience. We also provide practical lessons and insights
derived from developing, optimizing, and maintaining a production-scale
recommendation system with significant real-world impact.
title_zh: OneRec 技術報告
summary_zh: 傳統推薦系統效率不彰，AI技術難以有效應用。為了解決這些問題，我們提出了OneRec，一個端到端的生成式推薦系統，大幅提升了計算效率，並讓強化學習在推薦優化方面展現巨大潛力。透過基礎設施優化，我們在訓練和推論期間，於旗艦GPU上分別實現了23.7%和28.8%的模型FLOPs利用率，接近大型語言模型的水平。 OneRec顯著降低了通信和儲存開銷，運營成本僅為傳統推薦管道的10.6%。已部署於快手/快手極速版App，處理25%的總請求，App停留時間分別提升了0.54%和1.24%，7日生命週期等關鍵指標也顯著提升。

title: TensorSLM: Energy-efficient Embedding Compression of Sub-billion Parameter Language Models on Low-end Devices
summary:
Small Language Models (SLMs, or on-device LMs) have significantly fewer
parameters than Large Language Models (LLMs). They are typically deployed on
low-end devices, like mobile phones and single-board computers. Unlike LLMs,
which rely on increasing model size for better generalisation, SLMs designed
for edge applications are expected to have adaptivity to the deployment
environments and energy efficiency given the device battery life constraints,
which are not addressed in datacenter-deployed LLMs. This paper addresses these
two requirements by proposing a training-free token embedding compression
approach using Tensor-Train Decomposition (TTD). Each pre-trained token
embedding vector is converted into a lower-dimensional Matrix Product State
(MPS). We comprehensively evaluate the extracted low-rank structures across
compression ratio, language task performance, latency, and energy consumption
on a typical low-end device, i.e. Raspberry Pi. Taking the sub-billion
parameter versions of GPT-2/Cerebres-GPT and OPT models as examples, our
approach achieves a comparable language task performance to the original model
with around $2.0\times$ embedding layer compression, while the energy
consumption of a single query drops by half.
title_zh: TensorSLM：低端裝置上Sub-billion參數語言模型的節能嵌入壓縮
summary_zh: 本研究針對小型語言模型(SLM)在低端裝置(如手機、單板電腦)上的能源效率問題，提出一種免訓練的token嵌入壓縮方法TensorSLM，利用Tensor-Train分解(TTD)將預訓練的token嵌入向量轉換為低維度的Matrix Product State(MPS)。實驗結果顯示，在GPT-2、Cerebres-GPT和OPT等模型上，TensorSLM能在嵌入層壓縮約2倍的情況下，維持與原始模型相當的語言任務效能，同時單次查詢的能源消耗降低一半。此技術有助於SLM在資源受限的邊緣裝置上更高效地運行。
applications: **智慧家電語音助理：** 讓冰箱、冷氣等家電聽得懂更複雜的指令，且反應更快、更省電，不再只是簡單的開關功能。
**離線翻譯App：** 在沒有網路的環境下，也能即時翻譯，例如出國旅遊或在偏遠地區工作時，溝通更方便。
**兒童教育機器人：** 讓機器人更聰明，能回答小朋友千奇百怪的問題，並且根據對話內容提供更個人化的學習內容。
pitch: 各位投資人，想像一下，未來每個人口袋裡都有一台功能強大的AI助理，但它非常省電，而且不需要連網也能使用。TensorSLM正是實現這個願景的關鍵技術！它能大幅降低小型語言模型對硬體資源的需求，讓AI普及到各種低端裝置上。這代表什麼？無限的商機！從智慧家電、穿戴裝置到工業控制，各行各業都能利用TensorSLM打造更智能、更高效的產品和服務。我們預計，隨著邊緣運算的快速發展，TensorSLM將成為市場的迫切需求，其潛在商業價值將達到數十億美元。現在加入我們，一起引領這場AI革命，共同開創下一個科技黃金時代！

title: Dive3D: Diverse Distillation-based Text-to-3D Generation via Score Implicit Matching
summary:
Distilling pre-trained 2D diffusion models into 3D assets has driven
remarkable advances in text-to-3D synthesis. However, existing methods
typically rely on Score Distillation Sampling (SDS) loss, which involves
asymmetric KL divergence--a formulation that inherently favors mode-seeking
behavior and limits generation diversity. In this paper, we introduce Dive3D, a
novel text-to-3D generation framework that replaces KL-based objectives with
Score Implicit Matching (SIM) loss, a score-based objective that effectively
mitigates mode collapse. Furthermore, Dive3D integrates both diffusion
distillation and reward-guided optimization under a unified divergence
perspective. Such reformulation, together with SIM loss, yields significantly
more diverse 3D outputs while improving text alignment, human preference, and
overall visual fidelity. We validate Dive3D across various 2D-to-3D prompts and
find that it consistently outperforms prior methods in qualitative assessments,
including diversity, photorealism, and aesthetic appeal. We further evaluate
its performance on the GPTEval3D benchmark, comparing against nine
state-of-the-art baselines. Dive3D also achieves strong results on quantitative
metrics, including text-asset alignment, 3D plausibility, text-geometry
consistency, texture quality, and geometric detail.
title_zh: Dive3D：基於多樣化蒸餾與隱式分數匹配的文字轉3D生成
summary_zh: Dive3D 是一種全新的文字轉3D生成框架，旨在解決現有方法生成結果多樣性不足的問題。它採用隱式分數匹配（SIM）損失，取代了傳統的基於KL散度的目標函數，有效抑制了模型崩潰。Dive3D 整合了擴散蒸餾和獎勵引導優化，在提升文本對齊、人類偏好和整體視覺保真度的同時，顯著提高了3D輸出的多樣性。實驗證明，Dive3D 在多樣性、照片寫實度和美學吸引力方面均優於現有方法，並在多項指標上取得了優異的成績。
applications: 想像一下，設計師可以使用 Dive3D 快速將腦海中的設計概念轉化為逼真的3D模型，無需耗費大量時間建模，加速產品開發流程。
遊戲開發者可以利用 Dive3D 輕鬆創建各式各樣的遊戲物件和角色，豐富遊戲內容，降低開發成本。
一般使用者也能透過簡單的文字描述，生成獨一無二的3D列印模型，例如客製化的手機殼、玩具或藝術品，實現創意想法。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們相信 Dive3D 將徹底改變3D內容創作的格局。現今市場對3D模型的需求日益增長，從遊戲、影視到電商、元宇宙，各行各業都需要高品質的3D資產。然而，傳統的3D建模方式耗時費力，成本高昂。Dive3D 透過先進的AI技術，讓使用者僅需輸入文字，即可快速生成多樣化、高品質的3D模型，大幅降低了3D內容創作的門檻和成本。想像一下，未來每個人都能輕鬆創造自己的3D世界，Dive3D 將成為開啟元宇宙時代的鑰匙。我們預計，Dive3D 在遊戲、設計、電商、教育等領域都具有廣闊的應用前景，潛在市場規模巨大。現在投資 Dive3D，您將有機會參與到這場3D革命中，共同塑造未來!

title: An LLM's Apology: Outsourcing Awkwardness in the Age of AI
summary:
A key part of modern social dynamics is flaking at short notice. However,
anxiety in coming up with believable and socially acceptable reasons to do so
can instead lead to 'ghosting', awkwardness, or implausible excuses, risking
emotional harm and resentment in the other party. The ability to delegate this
task to a Large Language Model (LLM) could substantially reduce friction and
enhance the flexibility of user's social life while greatly minimising the
aforementioned creative burden and moral qualms. We introduce FLAKE-Bench, an
evaluation of models' capacity to effectively, kindly, and humanely extract
themselves from a diverse set of social, professional and romantic scenarios.
We report the efficacy of 10 frontier or recently-frontier LLMs in bailing on
prior commitments, because nothing says "I value our friendship" like having AI
generate your cancellation texts. We open-source FLAKE-Bench at
github.com/Cloakless/flake-bench to support future research.
title_zh: 大型語言模型的道歉：在人工智慧時代外包尷尬
summary_zh: 現代社交中，臨時爽約是常態，但編造合理藉口令人焦慮，可能導致「人間蒸發」、尷尬或不靠譜的理由，傷害對方情感。此研究提出將此任務委託給大型語言模型(LLM)，可減少摩擦，提升社交彈性，並減輕編造藉口的負擔和道德顧慮。研究團隊推出FLAKE-Bench，評估LLM在各種社交、職場和情感情境中脫身的能力，並測試了10個前沿LLM的效果。研究結果顯示，AI生成的取消訊息，可能無法有效維護人際關係。FLAKE-Bench已開源，以支持未來研究。
applications: 朋友臨時有約，但你實在太累想宅在家：不用絞盡腦汁想理由，AI幫你生成委婉又體面的推託訊息，避免尷尬。
工作邀約太多，時間喬不攏：AI根據你的行程和偏好，自動回覆婉拒，同時不失專業和禮貌。
約會前突然感到不舒服：AI幫你編寫貼心又關懷的取消訊息，讓對方感受到你的誠意，避免誤會。
pitch: 各位投資人，想像一下，現代人生活步調快速，時間管理壓力巨大，『社交過勞』已是普遍現象。我們的FLAKE-Bench技術，正是解決這個痛點的利器！透過AI自動生成道歉和婉拒訊息，不僅能大幅降低使用者的社交壓力，更能提升社交效率。未來，我們將整合此技術到各大社交平台、行程管理App，甚至開發個人化的『社交助理』服務。試想，當AI能精準掌握使用者的社交風格，提供客製化的回覆建議，這將徹底顛覆人際互動模式！我們預估，此技術在五年內將擁有數百萬用戶，創造數十億美元的市場價值。現在投資，你將成為這場社交革命的領航者！

title: A Survey on Imitation Learning for Contact-Rich Tasks in Robotics
summary:
This paper comprehensively surveys research trends in imitation learning for
contact-rich robotic tasks. Contact-rich tasks, which require complex physical
interactions with the environment, represent a central challenge in robotics
due to their nonlinear dynamics and sensitivity to small positional deviations.
The paper examines demonstration collection methodologies, including teaching
methods and sensory modalities crucial for capturing subtle interaction
dynamics. We then analyze imitation learning approaches, highlighting their
applications to contact-rich manipulation. Recent advances in multimodal
learning and foundation models have significantly enhanced performance in
complex contact tasks across industrial, household, and healthcare domains.
Through systematic organization of current research and identification of
challenges, this survey provides a foundation for future advancements in
contact-rich robotic manipulation.
title_zh: 機器人接觸密集型任務模仿學習綜述
summary_zh: 本研究全面回顧了機器人接觸密集型任務的模仿學習研究趨勢。接觸密集型任務因其非線性動力學和對微小位置偏差的敏感性，是機器人技術的核心挑戰。本文檢視了示範收集方法，包括教學方法和感官模式，這些對於捕捉細微的互動動力至關重要。接著，我們分析了模仿學習方法，強調其在接觸密集型操作中的應用。多模態學習和基礎模型的最新進展顯著提高了工業、家庭和醫療保健領域複雜接觸任務的效能。透過系統地組織當前研究和識別挑戰，本綜述為接觸密集型機器人操作的未來發展奠定了基礎。
applications: 想像一下，你家裡的機器人可以精準地幫你組裝IKEA家具，再也不用為了看不懂的說明書煩惱了！
在醫院裡，機器人可以協助護理人員進行精準的醫療操作，例如導管插入或傷口縫合，減少人為失誤。
工廠裡的機器人能更靈巧地處理複雜的零件組裝，大幅提升生產效率和產品品質。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們正在開發的技術是讓機器人具備像人類一樣的精細操作能力。接觸密集型任務是機器人自動化的最後一哩路，一旦突破，將能顛覆製造業、醫療保健、甚至家庭服務業。想像一下，一個機器人能像外科醫生一樣精準地進行手術，或像熟練的工匠一樣組裝複雜的產品。這不僅能大幅降低成本、提高效率，還能解決勞動力短缺的問題。我們的模仿學習技術，結合最新的多模態學習和基礎模型，讓機器人能夠從人類示範中學習，快速適應各種複雜的任務。我們預計在未來五年內，將我們的技術應用於醫療手術輔助、高精度製造和個人化家庭服務等領域，創造數十億美元的市場價值。現在加入我們，一起打造機器人自動化的未來！

title: Flexible-length Text Infilling for Discrete Diffusion Models
summary:
Discrete diffusion models are a new class of text generators that offer
advantages such as bidirectional context use, parallelizable generation, and
flexible prompting compared to autoregressive models. However, a critical
limitation of discrete diffusion models is their inability to perform
flexible-length or flexible-position text infilling without access to
ground-truth positional data. We introduce \textbf{DDOT} (\textbf{D}iscrete
\textbf{D}iffusion with \textbf{O}ptimal \textbf{T}ransport Position Coupling),
the first discrete diffusion model to overcome this challenge. DDOT jointly
denoises token values and token positions, employing a novel sample-level
Optimal Transport (OT) coupling. This coupling preserves relative token
ordering while dynamically adjusting the positions and length of infilled
segments, a capability previously missing in text diffusion. Our method is
orthogonal to existing discrete text diffusion methods and is compatible with
various pretrained text denoisers. Extensive experiments on text infilling
benchmarks such as One-Billion-Word and Yelp demonstrate that DDOT outperforms
naive diffusion baselines. Furthermore, DDOT achieves performance on par with
state-of-the-art non-autoregressive models and enables significant improvements
in training efficiency and flexibility.
title_zh: 離散擴散模型的彈性長度文字填空
summary_zh: 這項研究突破了離散擴散模型在文字填空上的限制。過去，這類模型無法在不知道確切位置資訊的情況下，靈活地填補文字。研究團隊開發了名為DDOT的新模型，它能同時處理文字內容和位置資訊的去噪。DDOT利用最佳傳輸（Optimal Transport）耦合技術，在保留文字相對順序的同時，動態調整填補文字的位置和長度。實驗證明，DDOT在文字填空任務上表現優異，甚至能與最先進的非自迴歸模型相媲美，同時提升了訓練效率和靈活性。這項技術為更自然、更智慧的文字生成應用開闢了新的道路。
applications: **智慧續寫小說：** 當你寫小說遇到瓶頸時，可以輸入部分情節，讓AI自動填補情節空缺，提供你意想不到的劇情發展。
**自動完成程式碼：** 程式設計師在撰寫程式碼時，只需輸入部分程式碼片段，AI就能根據上下文自動填補缺失的部分，提高編碼效率。
**修復老舊照片文字：** 針對老舊照片上模糊或缺失的文字，AI可以智能填補，讓歷史資料重見天日。
pitch: 想像一下，未來的AI不只是簡單的文字生成，而是能像一位資深的編輯，理解上下文、填補創意空白！我們的DDOT技術，正是實現這個願景的關鍵一步。它打破了傳統文字生成模型的限制，實現了前所未有的靈活性和效率。這意味著，我們可以在內容創作、程式開發、甚至歷史文獻修復等領域，看到顛覆性的應用。試想，如果我們能將DDOT整合到現有的AI寫作工具中，就能創造出一個真正能與人類協作的AI夥伴，大幅提升內容產出的質量和效率。這不僅僅是一項技術突破，更是一個巨大的商業機會，一個能重新定義內容產業的未來！我們相信，DDOT將成為下一代AI文字生成的核心引擎，為投資者帶來豐厚的回報。

title: xbench: Tracking Agents Productivity Scaling with Profession-Aligned Real-World Evaluations
summary:
We introduce xbench, a dynamic, profession-aligned evaluation suite designed
to bridge the gap between AI agent capabilities and real-world productivity.
While existing benchmarks often focus on isolated technical skills, they may
not accurately reflect the economic value agents deliver in professional
settings. To address this, xbench targets commercially significant domains with
evaluation tasks defined by industry professionals. Our framework creates
metrics that strongly correlate with productivity value, enables prediction of
Technology-Market Fit (TMF), and facilitates tracking of product capabilities
over time. As our initial implementations, we present two benchmarks:
Recruitment and Marketing. For Recruitment, we collect 50 tasks from real-world
headhunting business scenarios to evaluate agents' abilities in company
mapping, information retrieval, and talent sourcing. For Marketing, we assess
agents' ability to match influencers with advertiser needs, evaluating their
performance across 50 advertiser requirements using a curated pool of 836
candidate influencers. We present initial evaluation results for leading
contemporary agents, establishing a baseline for these professional domains.
Our continuously updated evalsets and evaluations are available at
https://xbench.org.
title_zh: xbench：透過與專業領域對齊的真實世界評估追蹤代理程式生產力擴展
summary_zh: xbench是一套動態、與專業領域對齊的評估套件，旨在彌合AI代理程式能力與真實世界生產力之間的差距。現有基準測試通常側重於孤立的技術技能，可能無法準確反映代理程式在專業環境中提供的經濟價值。xbench針對具有商業意義的領域，並由行業專業人士定義評估任務。我們的框架創建了與生產力價值密切相關的指標，能夠預測技術與市場的契合度（TMF），並促進產品能力的長期追蹤。我們初步實施了招聘和行銷兩個基準測試。我們從真實的獵頭業務場景中收集了50個任務，以評估代理程式在公司繪圖、資訊檢索和人才搜尋方面的能力。我們評估代理程式將影響者與廣告商需求匹配的能力，使用836位候選影響者的精選池，評估他們在50個廣告商需求中的表現。我們提供了領先的當代代理程式的初步評估結果，為這些專業領域建立了基準。
applications: 假設今天你想找一位擅長運動行銷的部落客來宣傳你的新運動鞋，你不用再大海撈針，xbench可以幫你快速找到最適合的潛在人選，省時省力。

當你想了解某個市場的趨勢和競爭對手，但沒有時間做大量的研究，xbench可以幫助你快速收集和整理相關資訊，讓你做出更明智的決策。

title: PRO: Projection Domain Synthesis for CT Imaging
summary:
Synthesizing high quality CT images remains a signifi-cant challenge due to
the limited availability of annotat-ed data and the complex nature of CT
imaging. In this work, we present PRO, a novel framework that, to the best of
our knowledge, is the first to perform CT image synthesis in the projection
domain using latent diffusion models. Unlike previous approaches that operate
in the image domain, PRO learns rich structural representa-tions from raw
projection data and leverages anatomi-cal text prompts for controllable
synthesis. This projec-tion domain strategy enables more faithful modeling of
underlying imaging physics and anatomical structures. Moreover, PRO functions
as a foundation model, capa-ble of generalizing across diverse downstream tasks
by adjusting its generative behavior via prompt inputs. Experimental results
demonstrated that incorporating our synthesized data significantly improves
perfor-mance across multiple downstream tasks, including low-dose and
sparse-view reconstruction, even with limited training data. These findings
underscore the versatility and scalability of PRO in data generation for
various CT applications. These results highlight the potential of projection
domain synthesis as a powerful tool for data augmentation and robust CT
imaging. Our source code is publicly available at:
https://github.com/yqx7150/PRO.
title_zh: PRO：用於CT影像的投影域合成
summary_zh: 本研究提出一個名為PRO的新框架，利用潛在擴散模型在投影域中合成CT影像，這是首創。與以往在影像域操作的方法不同，PRO從原始投影數據中學習豐富的結構表示，並利用解剖文本提示進行可控合成。這種投影域策略能夠更真實地模擬底層的成像物理和解剖結構。PRO還可作為基礎模型，通過調整提示輸入來泛化到各種下游任務。實驗結果表明，即使在有限的訓練數據下，加入我們合成的數據也能顯著提高低劑量和稀疏視角重建等多個下游任務的性能。PRO在數據生成方面具有多功能性和可擴展性，為各種CT應用提供強大的數據增強和穩健的CT成像。
applications: 想像一下，未來醫生可以使用這項技術，模擬不同病症的CT影像，讓醫學生在逼真的環境下練習診斷，提升學習效率。
如果機場安檢人員可以利用AI生成各種違禁品的CT影像，就能訓練安檢系統更精準地識別危險物品，提升公共安全。
考古學家可以利用這項技術，模擬古生物化石的CT影像，從而研究化石內部的結構，而無需破壞珍貴的化石本身。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們團隊的PRO技術，是CT影像領域的革命性突破！它不僅能有效解決CT影像數據稀缺的問題，更開創了在投影域進行合成的新途徑。想像一下，未來我們可以用極低的成本，生成無限量的、高品質的CT影像，這將徹底改變醫療影像、安檢、考古等領域的遊戲規則。PRO作為一個基礎模型，具有極高的可塑性，可以根據不同的需求進行定制，應用前景無限廣闊。我們預計，在未來五年內，PRO將成為CT影像領域的黃金標準，為我們的投資者帶來豐厚的回報。現在加入我們，共同開創AI醫療影像的新時代！

title: X-Scene: Large-Scale Driving Scene Generation with High Fidelity and Flexible Controllability
summary:
Diffusion models are advancing autonomous driving by enabling realistic data
synthesis, predictive end-to-end planning, and closed-loop simulation, with a
primary focus on temporally consistent generation. However, the generation of
large-scale 3D scenes that require spatial coherence remains underexplored. In
this paper, we propose X-Scene, a novel framework for large-scale driving scene
generation that achieves both geometric intricacy and appearance fidelity,
while offering flexible controllability. Specifically, X-Scene supports
multi-granular control, including low-level conditions such as user-provided or
text-driven layout for detailed scene composition and high-level semantic
guidance such as user-intent and LLM-enriched text prompts for efficient
customization. To enhance geometrical and visual fidelity, we introduce a
unified pipeline that sequentially generates 3D semantic occupancy and the
corresponding multiview images, while ensuring alignment between modalities.
Additionally, we extend the generated local region into a large-scale scene
through consistency-aware scene outpainting, which extrapolates new occupancy
and images conditioned on the previously generated area, enhancing spatial
continuity and preserving visual coherence. The resulting scenes are lifted
into high-quality 3DGS representations, supporting diverse applications such as
scene exploration. Comprehensive experiments demonstrate that X-Scene
significantly advances controllability and fidelity for large-scale driving
scene generation, empowering data generation and simulation for autonomous
driving.
title_zh: X-Scene：具備高擬真度和彈性可控性的大規模駕駛場景生成
summary_zh: X-Scene是一個創新的框架，用於生成大規模駕駛場景，兼具幾何複雜度和外觀擬真度，同時提供靈活的可控性。它支援多粒度控制，包括使用者提供的佈局或文字驅動的低階條件，以及使用者意圖和LLM增強的文字提示等高階語義引導，實現高效的客製化。該框架通過統一的流程，依序生成3D語義佔用和相應的多視圖圖像，確保模態之間的對齊。此外，通過一致性感知場景外繪，將生成的局部區域擴展到大規模場景，增強空間連續性並保持視覺一致性。生成的場景被提升為高品質的3DGS表示，支援場景探索等多種應用。實驗證明，X-Scene顯著提高了大規模駕駛場景生成的可控性和擬真度，為自動駕駛的數據生成和模擬提供強大支援。
applications: 1. 未來導航更聰明：想像一下，導航系統能根據你的心情和需求，即時生成沿途風景！想看櫻花？想避開擁擠路段？導航都能客製化，讓開車變成享受。
2. 電影拍攝更省錢：電影或遊戲製作需要大量逼真的城市或鄉村場景？X-Scene能快速生成，不再需要耗費巨資實地拍攝，大幅降低製作成本。
3. 自動駕駛訓練更安全：自動駕駛系統需要大量數據訓練，但真實道路測試風險高。X-Scene能生成各種極端天氣、突發狀況的模擬場景，讓AI在虛擬世界中安全學習。

各位投資人，想像一下，我們正在打造的不僅僅是一個場景生成工具，而是一個自動駕駛、遊戲、影視產業的『造物引擎』！X-Scene的核心技術，能以前所未有的擬真度和效率，創造出無限可能的駕駛場景。這意味著什麼？

更重要的是，X-Scene具備極高的可擴展性。未來，我們能將這項技術應用於智慧城市規劃、VR/AR體驗等領域，打造一個虛實融合的元宇宙。這是一個千億級的市場！

title: A Structured Bangla Dataset of Disease-Symptom Associations to Improve Diagnostic Accuracy
summary:
Disease-symptom datasets are significant and in demand for medical research,
disease diagnosis, clinical decision-making, and AI-driven health management
applications. These datasets help identify symptom patterns associated with
specific diseases, thus improving diagnostic accuracy and enabling early
detection. The dataset presented in this study systematically compiles
disease-symptom relationships from various online sources, medical literature,
and publicly available health databases. The data was gathered through
analyzing peer-reviewed medical articles, clinical case studies, and
disease-symptom association reports. Only the verified medical sources were
included in the dataset, while those from non-peer-reviewed and anecdotal
sources were excluded. The dataset is structured in a tabular format, where the
first column represents diseases, and the remaining columns represent symptoms.
Each symptom cell contains a binary value (1 or 0), indicating whether a
symptom is associated with a disease (1 for presence, 0 for absence). Thereby,
this structured representation makes the dataset very useful for a wide range
of applications, including machine learning-based disease prediction, clinical
decision support systems, and epidemiological studies. Although there are some
advancements in the field of disease-symptom datasets, there is a significant
gap in structured datasets for the Bangla language. This dataset aims to bridge
that gap by facilitating the development of multilingual medical informatics
tools and improving disease prediction models for underrepresented linguistic
communities. Further developments should include region-specific diseases and
further fine-tuning of symptom associations for better diagnostic performance
title_zh: 用於提升診斷準確性的疾病-症狀關聯結構化孟加拉語數據集
summary_zh: 本研究建立了一個結構化的孟加拉語疾病-症狀數據集，旨在填補該語言在醫療資訊領域的空白。數據集系統性地整理了來自線上資源、醫學文獻和公共健康數據庫的疾病與症狀關係，僅納入經過驗證的醫學來源。數據以表格形式呈現，疾病為首列，其餘列為症狀，並以二元值表示症狀與疾病的關聯性。此數據集可用於機器學習疾病預測、臨床決策支持系統和流行病學研究，有望改善孟加拉語社群的疾病預測模型，並促進多語言醫療資訊工具的開發。未來將納入特定區域疾病並進一步微調症狀關聯，以提升診斷效能。
applications: 想像一下，未來孟加拉語的使用者只要在家裡，就能透過手機App輸入自己的症狀，App就能根據這個數據集，提供初步的疾病風險評估，讓他們可以及早尋求醫療協助。
如果醫院導入這套系統，醫生就能在問診時，快速比對病患的症狀與數據庫，輔助醫生做出更精確的診斷，減少誤診的機率。
政府或衛生組織可以利用這個數據集，分析特定地區的疾病流行趨勢，提前做好防疫準備，例如針對高風險族群加強宣導或提供疫苗接種。
pitch: 各位投資人，我們正在打造的是孟加拉語醫療AI的基石！目前孟加拉語地區缺乏結構化的醫療數據，這導致AI醫療應用難以發展。我們的數據集填補了這個空白，它不僅能提升診斷準確性，更能催生一系列創新應用，例如個人化的健康管理App、AI輔助診斷系統，甚至是遠程醫療平台。想像一下，我們能將最先進的醫療技術帶給數億孟加拉語使用者，這是一個巨大的市場！而且，我們的數據收集方法具有高度的可擴展性，未來可以應用於其他語言和地區，成為全球性的醫療數據供應商。現在投資，您將成為這場醫療AI革命的先驅，共同打造一個更健康的世界！

title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) at First Glance: Studying the Security and Maintainability of MCP Servers
summary:
Although Foundation Models (FMs), such as GPT-4, are increasingly used in
domains like finance and software engineering, reliance on textual interfaces
limits these models' real-world interaction. To address this, FM providers
introduced tool calling-triggering a proliferation of frameworks with distinct
tool interfaces. In late 2024, Anthropic introduced the Model Context Protocol
(MCP) to standardize this tool ecosystem, which has become the de facto
standard with over eight million weekly SDK downloads. Despite its adoption,
MCP's AI-driven, non-deterministic control flow introduces new risks to
sustainability, security, and maintainability, warranting closer examination.
  Towards this end, we present the first large-scale empirical study of MCP
servers. Using state-of-the-art health metrics and a hybrid analysis pipeline,
combining a general-purpose static analysis tool with an MCP-specific scanner,
we evaluate 1,899 open-source MCP servers to assess their health, security, and
maintainability. Despite MCP servers demonstrating strong health metrics, we
identify eight distinct vulnerabilities -- only three overlapping with
traditional software vulnerabilities. Additionally, 7.2% of servers contain
general vulnerabilities and 5.5% exhibit MCP-specific tool poisoning. Regarding
maintainability, while 66% exhibit code smells, 14.4\% contain ten bug patterns
overlapping with traditional open-source software projects. These findings
highlight the need for MCP-specific vulnerability detection techniques while
reaffirming the value of traditional analysis and refactoring practices.
title_zh: 初探模型上下文協議 (MCP)：研究 MCP 伺服器的安全性與可維護性
summary_zh: 大型語言模型（LLM）如GPT-4的應用日益廣泛，但其文字介面限制了實際應用。為了解決此問題，Anthropic於2024年末推出了模型上下文協議（MCP），旨在標準化工具生態系統，並迅速成為業界標準。本研究針對1899個開源MCP伺服器進行大規模實證研究，評估其健康狀況、安全性和可維護性。研究發現，儘管MCP伺服器整體健康狀況良好，但仍存在八種獨特漏洞，其中部分與傳統軟體漏洞不同。此外，部分伺服器存在一般漏洞和MCP專有的工具中毒問題。研究結果強調了開發MCP專用漏洞檢測技術的必要性，同時也肯定了傳統分析和重構方法的價值。
applications: 想像一下，你正在用手機APP訂購外賣，這個APP使用了MCP技術，它能根據你的歷史訂單和當前天氣，自動推薦你可能喜歡的菜色，完全不需要你手動輸入任何關鍵字。
再想像一下，醫院的智慧醫療系統使用了MCP技術，醫生只需要用口語描述病人的症狀，系統就能自動分析病歷、檢查報告，並提供診斷建議和最佳治療方案，大大提升了診斷效率。
最後，想像一下，你的智慧家居系統使用了MCP技術，它能根據你的日常作息和環境感測器數據，自動調整室溫、燈光和音樂，讓你始終處於最舒適的環境中，真正實現了個性化的智能生活。

title: VideoPDE: Unified Generative PDE Solving via Video Inpainting Diffusion Models
summary:
We present a unified framework for solving partial differential equations
(PDEs) using video-inpainting diffusion transformer models. Unlike existing
methods that devise specialized strategies for either forward or inverse
problems under full or partial observation, our approach unifies these tasks
under a single, flexible generative framework. Specifically, we recast
PDE-solving as a generalized inpainting problem, e.g., treating forward
prediction as inferring missing spatiotemporal information of future states
from initial conditions. To this end, we design a transformer-based
architecture that conditions on arbitrary patterns of known data to infer
missing values across time and space. Our method proposes pixel-space video
diffusion models for fine-grained, high-fidelity inpainting and conditioning,
while enhancing computational efficiency through hierarchical modeling.
Extensive experiments show that our video inpainting-based diffusion model
offers an accurate and versatile solution across a wide range of PDEs and
problem setups, outperforming state-of-the-art baselines.
title_zh: VideoPDE：基於影片修復擴散模型的統一生成式偏微分方程求解
summary_zh: 本研究提出一個統一的框架，利用影片修復擴散轉換模型來解決偏微分方程（PDE）。不同於以往針對完整或部分觀測下的正向或反向問題設計專門策略的方法，我們的途徑將這些任務統一在一個靈活的生成框架下。具體來說，我們將PDE求解重新定義為一個廣義的修復問題，例如將正向預測視為從初始條件推斷未來狀態的缺失時空資訊。我們設計了一種基於轉換器的架構，可以根據已知的任意資料模式來推斷時間和空間上的缺失值。我們的模型採用像素空間影片擴散模型，實現精細、高保真的修復與條件設定，並通過分層建模提高計算效率。實驗結果表明，我們基於影片修復的擴散模型在各種PDE和問題設置中提供了準確而通用的解決方案，優於現有的最先進方法。

**醫療影像重建：** 透過這個技術，即使醫療影像（例如MRI或CT掃描）有部分缺失或雜訊，也能夠更精確地重建出完整的影像，幫助醫生做出更準確的診斷。
**流體力學模擬：** 工程師可以利用它來模擬汽車或飛機周圍的氣流，從而設計出更符合空氣動力學、更節能的交通工具。

title: DiFuse-Net: RGB and Dual-Pixel Depth Estimation using Window Bi-directional Parallax Attention and Cross-modal Transfer Learning
summary:
Depth estimation is crucial for intelligent systems, enabling applications
from autonomous navigation to augmented reality. While traditional stereo and
active depth sensors have limitations in cost, power, and robustness,
dual-pixel (DP) technology, ubiquitous in modern cameras, offers a compelling
alternative. This paper introduces DiFuse-Net, a novel modality decoupled
network design for disentangled RGB and DP based depth estimation. DiFuse-Net
features a window bi-directional parallax attention mechanism (WBiPAM)
specifically designed to capture the subtle DP disparity cues unique to
smartphone cameras with small aperture. A separate encoder extracts contextual
information from the RGB image, and these features are fused to enhance depth
prediction. We also propose a Cross-modal Transfer Learning (CmTL) mechanism to
utilize large-scale RGB-D datasets in the literature to cope with the
limitations of obtaining large-scale RGB-DP-D dataset. Our evaluation and
comparison of the proposed method demonstrates its superiority over the DP and
stereo-based baseline methods. Additionally, we contribute a new, high-quality,
real-world RGB-DP-D training dataset, named Dual-Camera Dual-Pixel (DCDP)
dataset, created using our novel symmetric stereo camera hardware setup, stereo
calibration and rectification protocol, and AI stereo disparity estimation
method.
title_zh: DiFuse-Net：利用窗口雙向視差注意力與跨模態遷移學習進行RGB與雙像素深度估計
summary_zh: DiFuse-Net 是一種新穎的深度估計網路，專為利用智慧型手機相機中普遍存在的雙像素（DP）技術而設計。它採用窗口雙向視差注意力機制（WBiPAM）來捕捉微小的DP視差線索，並使用跨模態遷移學習（CmTL）來利用現有的大型RGB-D數據集，克服RGB-DP-D數據集稀缺的限制。DiFuse-Net 透過分離RGB圖像和DP圖像的特徵提取，再融合這些特徵以增強深度預測的準確性。實驗結果表明，DiFuse-Net 在深度估計方面優於現有的DP和立體視覺方法。研究團隊還創建了一個高品質的真實世界RGB-DP-D訓練數據集（DCDP）。
applications: **智慧型手機人像模式增強：**  讓手機人像模式的景深效果更自然、更精準，虛化背景更逼真，甚至能模擬專業相機的大光圈效果，拍出媲美單眼相機的照片。

title: Scaling-Up the Pretraining of the Earth Observation Foundation Model PhilEO to the MajorTOM Dataset
summary:
Today, Earth Observation (EO) satellites generate massive volumes of data,
with the Copernicus Sentinel-2 constellation alone producing approximately
1.6TB per day. To fully exploit this information, it is essential to pretrain
EO Foundation Models (FMs) on large unlabeled datasets, enabling efficient
fine-tuning for several different downstream tasks with minimal labeled data.
In this work, we present the scaling-up of our recently proposed EO Foundation
Model, PhilEO Geo-Aware U-Net, on the unlabeled 23TB dataset MajorTOM, which
covers the vast majority of the Earth's surface, as well as on the specialized
subset FastTOM 2TB that does not include oceans and ice. We develop and study
various PhilEO model variants with different numbers of parameters and
architectures. Finally, we fine-tune the models on the PhilEO Bench for road
density estimation, building density pixel-wise regression, and land cover
semantic segmentation, and we evaluate the performance. Our results demonstrate
that for all n-shots for road density regression, the PhilEO 44M MajorTOM 23TB
model outperforms PhilEO Globe 0.5TB 44M. We also show that for most n-shots
for road density estimation and building density regression, PhilEO 200M
FastTOM outperforms all the other models. The effectiveness of both dataset and
model scaling is validated using the PhilEO Bench. We also study the impact of
architecture scaling, transitioning from U-Net Convolutional Neural Networks
(CNN) to Vision Transformers (ViT).
title_zh: 將地球觀測基礎模型PhilEO擴展到MajorTOM數據集上的預訓練
summary_zh: 現今地球觀測衛星產生龐大數據，僅Copernicus Sentinel-2每日就產出約1.6TB。為充分利用這些資訊，必須在大型未標記數據集上預訓練地球觀測基礎模型(FMs)，以便用最少的標記數據，有效微調各種下游任務。本研究將我們提出的地球觀測基礎模型PhilEO Geo-Aware U-Net擴展到涵蓋地球大部分表面的23TB未標記數據集MajorTOM，以及不包括海洋和冰的2TB專用子集FastTOM。我們開發並研究了不同參數和架構的PhilEO模型變體。最後，我們在PhilEO Bench上針對道路密度估計、建築密度像素級回歸和土地覆蓋語義分割微調模型，並評估性能。實驗結果表明，對於所有道路密度回歸的n-shots，PhilEO 44M MajorTOM 23TB模型優於PhilEO Globe 0.5TB 44M。我們還表明，對於大多數道路密度估計和建築密度回歸的n-shots，PhilEO 200M FastTOM優於所有其他模型。數據集和模型擴展的有效性已通過PhilEO Bench驗證。我們還研究了架構擴展的影響，從U-Net卷積神經網絡(CNN)過渡到Vision Transformers (ViT)。

title: CDP: Towards Robust Autoregressive Visuomotor Policy Learning via Causal Diffusion
summary:
Diffusion Policy (DP) enables robots to learn complex behaviors by imitating
expert demonstrations through action diffusion. However, in practical
applications, hardware limitations often degrade data quality, while real-time
constraints restrict model inference to instantaneous state and scene
observations. These limitations seriously reduce the efficacy of learning from
expert demonstrations, resulting in failures in object localization, grasp
planning, and long-horizon task execution. To address these challenges, we
propose Causal Diffusion Policy (CDP), a novel transformer-based diffusion
model that enhances action prediction by conditioning on historical action
sequences, thereby enabling more coherent and context-aware visuomotor policy
learning. To further mitigate the computational cost associated with
autoregressive inference, a caching mechanism is also introduced to store
attention key-value pairs from previous timesteps, substantially reducing
redundant computations during execution. Extensive experiments in both
simulated and real-world environments, spanning diverse 2D and 3D manipulation
tasks, demonstrate that CDP uniquely leverages historical action sequences to
achieve significantly higher accuracy than existing methods. Moreover, even
when faced with degraded input observation quality, CDP maintains remarkable
precision by reasoning through temporal continuity, which highlights its
practical robustness for robotic control under realistic, imperfect conditions.
title_zh: CDP：透過因果擴散實現穩健的自迴歸視覺運動策略學習
summary_zh: 本研究提出了一種名為因果擴散策略(CDP)的新方法，旨在提升機器人學習複雜行為的能力。CDP利用歷史動作序列來預測未來的動作，使機器人能更連貫且更理解情境地學習視覺運動策略。此外，我們還引入了一種緩存機制，用於儲存先前時間步的注意力鍵值對，從而顯著減少執行期間的冗餘計算，降低計算成本。實驗結果表明，CDP即使在輸入觀察品質下降的情況下，也能透過時間連續性進行推理，保持卓越的精確度，展現了其在真實、不完美條件下進行機器人控制的實用穩健性。在模擬和真實環境中，CDP在2D和3D操作任務中都表現出比現有方法更高的準確性。

自動駕駛：自動駕駛汽車可以利用過去的駕駛經驗和周圍車輛的行為模式，更準確地預測其他車輛的動向，從而做出更安全的決策，降低事故風險。
醫療手術：手術機器人可以透過學習資深外科醫生的操作序列，並根據患者的即時生理數據，執行更精準、更安全的手術，減少手術時間和患者的痛苦。

title: Unified Software Engineering agent as AI Software Engineer
summary:
The growth of Large Language Model (LLM) technology has raised expectations
for automated coding. However, software engineering is more than coding and is
concerned with activities including maintenance and evolution of a project. In
this context, the concept of LLM agents has gained traction, which utilize LLMs
as reasoning engines to invoke external tools autonomously. But is an LLM agent
the same as an AI software engineer? In this paper, we seek to understand this
question by developing a Unified Software Engineering agent or USEagent. Unlike
existing work which builds specialized agents for specific software tasks such
as testing, debugging, and repair, our goal is to build a unified agent which
can orchestrate and handle multiple capabilities. This gives the agent the
promise of handling complex scenarios in software development such as fixing an
incomplete patch, adding new features, or taking over code written by others.
We envision USEagent as the first draft of a future AI Software Engineer which
can be a team member in future software development teams involving both AI and
humans. To evaluate the efficacy of USEagent, we build a Unified Software
Engineering bench (USEbench) comprising of myriad tasks such as coding,
testing, and patching. USEbench is a judicious mixture of tasks from existing
benchmarks such as SWE-bench, SWT-bench, and REPOCOD. In an evaluation on
USEbench consisting of 1,271 repository-level software engineering tasks,
USEagent shows improved efficacy compared to existing general agents such as
OpenHands CodeActAgent. There exist gaps in the capabilities of USEagent for
certain coding tasks, which provides hints on further developing the AI
Software Engineer of the future.
title_zh: 統一軟體工程代理：作為AI軟體工程師
summary_zh: 大型語言模型（LLM）的發展提升了人們對自動化編碼的期望。然而，軟體工程不僅僅是編碼，還包括專案的維護和演進。本研究開發了一種統一軟體工程代理（USEagent），旨在建立一個能夠協調和處理多種能力的統一代理，以應對軟體開發中的複雜場景，例如修復不完整的補丁、新增功能或接管他人編寫的程式碼。我們將USEagent視為未來AI軟體工程師的雛形，它可以成為未來由AI和人類組成的軟體開發團隊中的一員。USEagent在包含1,271個儲存庫級別軟體工程任務的USEbench評估中，顯示出比現有通用代理更好的效果。研究結果揭示了USEagent在某些編碼任務中的能力差距，為未來AI軟體工程師的開發提供了方向。
applications: 想像一下，未來你想要開發一個手機App，只需要用口語描述你的想法，AI就能自動生成App的程式碼，甚至還能幫你測試和除錯，讓你輕鬆成為App開發者。
